questions.question_text: Select the one capability that restricts connections from one CI to other devices.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Explanation: ebook p.147, Isolate Host: Provides a way to Isolate an endpoint or a host assoicated with a security incident, Isolate host is executed against a configuration item (CI). Example: Carbon Black.

questions.question_text: What factor, if any, limits the ability to close SIR records?

choices.C: Nothing, SIR records could be closed at any time
choices.B: Best practice dictates that SIR records should be set to 'Resolved' never to 'Closed'
choices.D: All post-incident review questioners have to be completed first

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
All post-incident review questioners have to be completed first

Selected Answer: D
from my experience working in servicenow SIRs. i need to complete the post incident questionaire. i see some have answered A and D quoting Ebooks? where can i get those?

Selected Answer: D
Security Incident cannot be closed until all questionnaries have been completed.

Selected Answer: A
A is the right answer.
According to the Ebook of Security Incident Response ( Tokyo ) page 240

Selected Answer: D
Cannot close SIR until all the questionnaire answers by participants

Selected Answer: A
Explanation: if there are opened related incident records, then the current SIR record cannot be closed

comments.content: Sorry, thats correct, it's D. Explanation: ebook p.240, Security Incident cannot be closed until all questionnaries have been completed.

choices.E: Hashes and/or file names found in the EML attachment
choices.A: URLs, domains, or IP addresses appearing in the body
choices.F: Type of Ingestion Rule used to identify this email as a phishing attempt

questions.question_text: When the Security Phishing Email record is created what types of observables are stored in the record? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ADE
Vancouver p. 334

IP addresses from the header
URLs, domains, or IP addresses appearing in the body
Hashes found in the EML attachment
File names foind in the EML attachment

Selected Answer: ADE
According to the ebook of Security Incident Response ( Tokyo ) p.98, 
Observables stateful properties:
E-Observed MD5 hashes (e)
A- Observed IP address (a)
D- Observed email addresses (d)

Selected Answer: ADE
Explanation: ebook p.98, Observables stateful properties:
 - Observed MD5 hashes (e)
 - Observed IP address (a)
 - Observed DNS names (a)
 - Observed email addresses (d)

questions.question_text: What plugin must be activated to see the New Security Analyst UI?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Security Incident Response UI plugin

Selected Answer: B
According to the ebook of Security Incident Response ( Tokyo ) page 295 :
"to activate the new security Analyst UI, the request the security Incident Response UI Plugin (com.app_secops_ui) through Now support (HI) portal"

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
Security Incident Response UI is the correct answer, A, C and D doesn't exist in the OOB instance store

questions.question_text: The following term is used to describe any observable occurrence: __________.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
an indication that something notable has occurred.

Selected Answer: E
Should be E, my bad
